data.title: A little princess 1995
data.text:

1-week checkout Youth-DVD Movies Little 1-week checkout On Shelf

Originally released as a motion picture in 1995.

"Based on the novel by Frances Hodgson Burnett"--Container.

"Standard version: formatted from its original version to fit your screen. Widescreen version: presented in a "matted" widescreen format preserving the aspect ratio of its original theatrical exhibition. Enhanced for widescreen TVs."--Container.

Includes interactive menus, scene access, 3 theatrical trailers, remastered Dolby digital soundtrack.

Eleanor Bron, Liam Cunningham, Liesel Matthews.

Sara Crewe is the pampered daughter of an Army officer who is left in a strict boarding school when her father goes off to war. When he is reported dead, her world is turned upside down and she is made a servant at the school, yet she refuses to let her spirit be broken.

DVD; widescreen & full screen.

Contents: Sara Crewe.

COMMUNITY REVIEWS

good movie submitted by 1funone on August 14, 2011, 7:34pm it really is a heart warming tale

sure to touch your heart

Great submitted by nicenora2371 on July 12, 2013, 12:28am Great to watch

Wonderful movie submitted by echternk on August 1, 2013, 2:50pm This version of the story features beautiful cinematography, a believable cast, and so much scope for the imagination, that I wanted a sequel, or at least more from this cast.

A Little Princess submitted by SBNB on July 11, 2014, 1:06pm It's not my favorite version of A Little Princess, but it's still quite good!

A fave submitted by lfmarcus on August 19, 2017, 4:13pm This was definitely a favorite as I was growing up. The father/daughter relationship especially was so moving.

Fave submitted by Munchkin on July 14, 2018, 4:31pm I cried so much when I watched this movie I say 1000 stars of this movie the story line is so good

Probably the reason I studied abroad in India submitted by edb.blanchard on August 9, 2018, 10:32am I think of this movie every time I read the Ramayana. #liberalartsnerd

Classic submitted by zmclaugh on June 19, 2019, 10:30pm A classic adaptation of the novel. Really well done.
